template.description: Updated to use 1 port for all groups that are apis
template.name: Example Flows updated

labels.label: You may want to look through the flows in this group before attempting the below task --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- These two process groups are not APIs and therefore do not require the HandleHttpRequest processor to start See if you can add 'Http Invocation From Flow processor' group to 'Basic Examples' processor group and then get a FlowFile to be routed to it
This processor allows some HTTP request to enter the flow with all its attributes and content

This processor allows for an HTTP call to be made during the flow rather than using an HTTP call from outside the API to start the flow -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- When this processor does not have an incoming connection, it will run whenever it is scheduled to run (Scheduling tab) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- When this processor has an incoming connection then it will run whenever a FlowFile is sent to it
This processor allows for creation or update of the attributes of the FlowFile

This processor is used to store the content of the FlowFile on the machine running ThreadConnect ----------------------------------------------------------- This file is named using the 'filename' property set in the UpdateAttribute processor ----------------------------------------------------------- For demonstration purposes, this processor replaces any files with the same name as the file it creates, but this option can be modified to keep all files or ignore the incoming file

This processor can be connected to the InvokeHTTP processor to show an invocation based on an incoming FlowFile ------------------------------------------------------------------ To connect the two processors (a) hover over the GenerateFlowFile processor (b) Click and hold the dark-colored circle that appears in the middle of the processor (c) Drag the mouse pointer over the InvokeHTTP processor (d) When the InvokeHTTP processor gets a highlighted green border around it, release the pointer and a connection should be made

This processor enables data to be appended to, prepended to, or removed from the content of a FlowFile. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what or where in the content to edit data

Local Machine comments: ------------------------------- The API the InvokeHttp processor is invoking may not work on the GE network --------------------------------------------------------------------- Either get off the GE network or attempt to hit a different API
This template demonstrates an HTTP request called from within the flow rather than one called from outside the flow
This processor allows for creation or update of the attributes of the FlowFile

labels.label: The input / output ports are needed whenever a connection is going into a process group or out of a process group --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- To place an input port, drag the Input Port symbol with an arrow going into it onto the canvas. The symbol is directly to the right of the Processor symbol
This flow demonstrates a one-to-one JSON to JSON transformation using Jolt Transformation Language and its complementary processor
This processor allows one to do JSON to JSON transformations

This processor will prepend data to the current content of the FlowFile --------------------------------------------------- This processor also allows for data to be 'appended to' or 'removed from' the content of a FlowFile ---------------------------------------------------- All of these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what to edit or where in the content of the FlowFile to edit
This processor allows an HTTP response to be sent back to the source of the earlier HTTP request
This processor allows some FlowFile to be sent back as a response
This processor allows data in the body of the FlowFile to be inserted as an attribute of the FlowFile.
This processor demonstrates the use of inserting an attribute into the content of its FlowFile based on the name of the attribute
This template shows how one might use a retry loop

This processor enables data to be appended to, prepended to, removed from the content of a FlowFile. It can also replace data. ------------------------------------------- All of these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what to edit or where in the content of the FlowFile to edit.
A process group serves to group a set of similarly-used processes in order to cause less processors to clutter the canvas

This processor enables data to be appended to, prepended to, removed from the content of a FlowFile. It can also replace data. --------------------------------------------------------- All of these options are based on a regular expression used to signal what to edit or where in the content of the FlowFile to edit. -------------------------------------------------------- Text can also be 'hard-coded' into the FlowFile

processGroups.comments:
This flow will track how many times a given flow file routes through it. If the number of times exceeds a specific maximum then it will route to the 'limit exceeded' port. Otherwise it will route to 'retry'.
The attributes it uses are 'retry.counter' and 'retry.maxcount'. If the 'retry.maxcount' is specified on a given flowfile then it will be honored. Otherwise a default of '3' is set as the maximum retry count.
As the flowfile goes through this flow it increments the 'retry.maxcount' attribute by 1. It then checks if this value exceeds 'retry.maxcount' and if so then it routes the flowfile to 'limit exceeded' otherwise it routes to 'retry'.
So you can configure the 'retry' relationship to loop back to the process you want and you can send the 'limit exceeded' to move on from that process to something else.

outputPorts.comments: Items sent to this port have not yet exceeded the maximum retry count.
outputPorts.name: retry

processGroups.name: Retry Check Loop

entry.value: All required content and attributes exist
${http.headers.startdate:isNull():append('startdate Header is missing')} ${RouteOnContent:equals('unmatched'):not():append('Invalid enddate in content')}

The chosen "Initial Route" appears to be invalid. Please enter one of the following strings as "Initial Route" value and retry the request:
exposeHttp joltTransformation retryLoop routeOnContentAndAttribute

labels.label: This example demonstrates how one might create a table in some database using only information from a file --------------------------------------------------- Final processor contains the 'create table' statement
Gets a file from the system Filename is that which table name needs to be First line in file contains table column names
This processor is used to show the final SQL statement that would otherwise be put into some PutSql processor
SQL statement is updated to include table column names
SQL statement is created with placeholders for data from other processors "varchar" is appended to each column name

How does one view the contents of the FlowFile at or after the event?
1. Right-click the processor in question. In this case, right-click the ReplaceText Processor 2. Select Data Provenance from the menu 3. Wait while the data is loaded to the screen 4. Click on the Information symbol (first column of the table) in the row containing the FlowFile you want to view 5. Click the Content tab 6. Click one of the View Content buttons a. The View Content button on the LEFT side of the window shows a snapshot of the data before the processor processes it b. The View Content button on the RIGHT side of the window shows a snapshot of the data after the processor processes it
filename attribute is updated to exclude the extension

This processor creates a new attribute for the FlowFile. The attribute contains the entire first line of the FlowFile. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- To capture only the first line, property 'Enable repeating capture groups' was set to false
SQL statement is updated to include table name
